StringLiteralExpr.value: This is the name used by the library file.
For Windows the library file is called BASE.dll, where BASE is the base name.
For Unix the library file is called libBASE.a, where BASE is the base name.
Blendenpik pre-builds FFTW plans for sizes QUANT * n (n = 1, 2, ...). Intermediate values are padded with zero.
Please enter max size for autotunning (default is 150,000):
Values are 0-4. Higher value - longer build time, faster running time.
Do you have SPIRAL WHT installed?
This is the name used by the library file.
For Windows the library file is called BASE.dll, where BASE is the base name.
For Unix the library file is called libBASE.a, where BASE is the base name.
Either FFTW or SPIRAL WHT must be used!
Additonal flags - TIP: if you are on UNIX having problem with gfortran try LD="gfortran"
